Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the number of changes made by President Obama to his own health care law. The expert's verdict mentions that a dozen of those adjustments took place before the 2012 election, not after as claimed.
Understate: There is no indication of understatement in the claim or the expert's verdict.
Falters at times: The claim may falter at times by not accurately representing the timing of the changes made to the health care law.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to fully substantiate the assertion that President Obama has amended, delayed, or repealed 19 components of his own health care law. The expert's verdict mentions that the Congressional Research Service listed 19 times the Affordable Care Act changed, but it also clarifies that most of the items on the list are less dramatic.
Problematic assumption: There is no clear problematic assumption in the claim or the expert's verdict.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim or the expert's verdict.
